intro: Psychotria chaenotricha, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptic leaves with hairy surfaces, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Psychotria chaenotricha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
